title: Ticket #1420: Change default for STARTD_SENDS_ALIVES
description: See commit [8978] - the default for STARTD_SENDS_ALIVES should change from False to True. This of course would be trivial, except it should have some backwards compatibility handling
remarks:
2010-May-26 12:22:20 by matt:
See also #671

2010-Aug-09 14:55:19 by jfrey:
See also #1568.

2010-Aug-09 15:14:00 by jfrey:
Both the schedd and startd know the Condor version of their peer. The default for STARTD_SENDS_ALIVES can be dictated by the version of the peer. If the peer is older than the version when the default behavior switched, use the old behavior (schedd sends alives).

2010-Aug-16 16:42:42 by jfrey:
Pushed changes to master for 7.5.4. In 7.5.4 and beyond, the default is for the startd to send keep-alives to the schedd. If a daemon detects that it's talking to a pre-7.5.4 peer, it will revert to the old default of the schedd sending the keep-alives.
